Title:
Hyphodontia subflavipora sp. nov. (Schizoporaceae,
Basidiomycota) from East Asia
Abstract:
Hyphodontia subflavipora (Schizoporaceae) is described as
a new species collected from 2 tropical and subtropical regions of East
Asia. This new species is characterized by 3 resupinate basidiocarps,
poroid hymenophore, pseudodimitic hyphal system, nodose-4 septate
hyphae, four kinds of cystidia (capitate, acicular or cylindrical,
subulate to 5 ventrose cystidia, and apically-encrusted), and
thin-walled, colorless, smooth and 6 ellipsoid basidiospores. Both
Maximum Parsimony and Bayesian algorisms were used to 7 constructed
phylogenies inferred from internal transcribed spacer (ITS) region of
rDNA. 8 Morphological and molecular studies, along with
intercompatibility test confirmed the 9 independent status of this
species. A global key to known species of Hyphodontia s.l. 10 with
poroid, irpicoid or raduloid hymenophore were provided for further
convenience in 11 identification.
